user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketSendTo:
```c
int32 OS_SocketSendTo(osal_id_t sock_id, const void *buffer, size_t buflen, const OS_SockAddr_t *RemoteAddr)
{
    OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;
    OS_object_token_t            token;
    int32                        return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(buffer);
    OS_CHECK_SIZE(buflen);
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(RemoteAddr);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_REFCOUNT, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sock_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        stream = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, token);

        if (stream->socket_type != OS_SocketType_DATAGRAM)
        {
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_TYPE;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_SocketSendTo_Impl(&token, buffer, buflen, RemoteAddr);
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (stream->socket_type != OS_SocketType_DATAGRAM)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The expression accesses the member socket_type through the pointer variable 'stream' (declared as OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream). Rule 8.13 concerns whether pointer types should be const-qualified when they are only used to access data. In this fragment the pointer is only used to read the member, so the check itself does not demonstrate a rule violation. Determining a true violation would require evidence that 'stream' could have been declared as a pointer to const (i.e. OS_stream_internal_record_t const *stream) everywhere it is used; that information is not present here. Therefore this fragment alone does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
